title: Not working properly
text:
I am so disappointed!  I have been trying to set up my work Outlook account on my phone for quite some time.

For some history, it was on my current phone but after having to do a factory reset, Outlook was requesting me to authenticate on Microsoft Authenticator.  

Now, when I click on the link through Outlook, I’m taken to Authenticator and it states to enter the 2-digit number in the Authenticator app.  However, I am already in the app.

Trying to get a 6-digit code is a joke as well since the codes generated are 8-digits.

It’s so messed up that my IT team has no idea how to fix it and I was told they were not requiring the authenticator.

I’m running on an iPhone 14 Plus.

title: Useless
text: Until the most recent iOS update I was able to log into my Microsoft Outlook work email account without any issues. Now, every time I attempt to login it pulls up the authentication app I receive an error stating my sign in was successful but does not meet the criteria to access this resource. I do not know what this means but the issue is I can no access my work email. I’m hoping this a software update bug that will be resolved soon. You cannot access this right now Your sign-in was successful but does not meet the criteria to access this resource. For example, you might be signing in from a browser, app, or location that is restricted by your admin. I recently found out from a colleague that my company’s IT people purposely restricted our access to check email outside of work for security reasons. It isn’t a software bug but was done by design. Prior to this change the app seemed to function normally.

title: Infuriating
text: I have no choice but to use this app to sign into my work email. Oh, your password expired, you have to change it and now you're trying to log back into the Outlook app with your new password? Good luck. It's so frustrating that I don't even know how to describe what starts happening. There is an overlap where THIS app is asking me to enter a verification code while I'm also trying to verify my login to Outlook. NEWS FLASH Authenticator - I AM LITERALLY ON THE AUTHENTICATOR APP. Why are you asking me to open the Authenticator app, when I am literally ON the Authenticator app???? How am I supposed to get a verification code when I can't get past this request for a code that is impossible to get?? Where am I supposed to get this special code outside of this app??? Makes absolutely no sense.

title: Bring back Apple Watch support
text: That’s it, that’s all I need. When I get an authentication push, I want to be able to respond on my watch without having to get to my phone, unlock it, open the app. Too many steps. Other authentication apps get this right, and this app used to, but took it away. Really frustrating.

title: Shills? Awfulcator > Authenticator
text: I can’t believe the number of 5 star reviews! This app is garbage, it gets stuck in loops and says the QR code has been used already when just got it! Once it crashes like this then you outlook app quits working and you have to uninstall and then get any IT security involved to clear everything back to day one on your server side of thing, reinstall this useless app as I already have to get a texted passcode too, then go through logging back in, get a text code, start the Awfulcator app, scan the QR, enter a 2 digit (unbelievably security there from automated hacking), then I’m back in! Of course I’ve either lost a hour of productivity or I’ve lost a customer but hey the hacks at Microsoft can pat themselves on the back. Hope your experience is better but once I no longer have to have anything Microsoft then I’ll be all Linux and never look back!!

title: Poor execution of a good concept
text: This software is designed to speed password verification. Unfortunately it works poorly. It is not always clear which account is being verified. It relies on text notifications, which don’t work without a phone or Internet connection. It is doesn’t function well when logged into more than one account (e.g., work and home). And it attempts to override other password verification software, which is a problem since it only really works with Microsoft products. Another product that tries to overcome Microsoft’s mediocrity at working with other platforms.

title: This makes no sense to me
text:
I am trying to sign into outlook on my phone, and the outlook app sends me directly to the Authenticator app when I go to sign in. Then once im in Authenticator, the app asks me to retrieve a code from Authenticator and enter it… how am I supposed to retrieve the code from the app that I’m already in, and then enter it into the app that I’m already in? How does this app not realize that I’m in Authenticator when it sends me a code to go retrieve in Authenticator? 

I guess I just can’t log into outlook anymore on my phone. Has anyone else had this problem? Or does anyone know how to fix it?
